MNISTCopyTask module¶

Repeat a sequence of MNIST images.

The goal is to replicate a sequence of MNIST images. The input is a sequence of MNIST images, followed by black images of the same sequence length. The ideal output is a vector of zeros for each actual image. When the black images begin, the DNC should emit a one-hot vector repeating the class of the real images.

conv_layer(inputs, filters_out, kernel_shape=(5, 5), stride=(2, 2))¶

A basic convolutional layer with VALID padding and relu activation.

Parameters:
  • inputs – The NCHW stack of images.
  • filters_out – The desired number of output filters.
Keyword Arguments:
 
  • kernel_shape ((5, 5)) – A length-2 iterable.
  • stride ((2, 2)) – A length-2 iterable.
MNISTCopyTask.builtin_mnist_input(mnist_dset, seq_len, batch_size, train=True)¶

Use the MNIST input module from the tutorials.

Before, create an mnist dataset using the tutorial api. Call this during the training loop.
